summary: In this context, chlorobenzene is discussed in relation to its potential immuno-modulatory and inflammatory effects on human lung epithelial cells and peripheral blood mononuclear cells. The study investigates how exposure to chlorobenzene can influence the release of inflammatory mediators, indicating its relevance in allergic sensitization and immune response, particularly in children. The term is consistently used to refer to the same chemical compound, emphasizing its significance in the research.
